JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON of ORG , GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant received a notice of intended prosecution requiring him to name the driver of his car on DATE . The applicant declined to sign the form , maintaining that the car belonged to his employer .

On DATE , ORG convicted the applicant of an offence under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Road Traffic Act DATE for failing to give information as to the identity of the driver of his car . He was fined GBP CARDINAL and ordered to pay GBP CARDINAL costs , with his licence to be endorsed with CARDINAL penalty points .
The applicant appealed to ORG , invoking Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Convention . It rejected his appeal after a hearing on DATE .
The relevant domestic law and practice are set out in O’Halloran and PERSON the GPE [ ORG ] , ORG . ORG , § § DATE , ORG DATE ...
